name: The Tubkaak Krabi Boutique Resort

reviews.text: How anyone can suggest that this hotel is dissapointing is beyond our belief. We are a young couple (25 and 26) and we stayed 5 nights at The Tubkaak after staying 5 nights at Phi Phi Island Village Hotel and 2 nights at Le Bua State Tower Hotel in Bangkok - All booked off Trip Advisor Recommendations.
reviews.title: Marvellous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a deluxe room with a view overlooking the pool. The room was magnificent - clean, tidy and quaintly designed in Thai architecture, set amongst beautiful lush vegetation, outside sunken bath, shower, etc.....
reviews.title: Perfect honeymoon getaway

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is secluded, away from the hustle and bustle of any roads, towns etc. and there are nearby hotels being built. These are far enough away from the resort to to worry about. The hotel hosts a private beach which boasts fantastic views of the sunsets and marvellous Hong Islands where you can enjoy a cold beer or Pina Colada on the beach and watch the sun go down. Sun loungers are banned in Krabi so The Tubkaak provides extra large bean bags for your pleasure to sun bathe. If you want to go to a more built up area then you simply book a car with the hotel which takes you to Ao Nang (£10/way) - Well worth a visit for one night. We went for one night to experience the market stalls and enjoy some local cuisine.
reviews.title: The perfect relaxation destination

reviews.text: The hotel also book excursions for you if you want to get out and about for the day. We visited James Bond Island - which included a half hour elephant trek, sea kayaking, visit to Monkey cave and lunch at the Muslim floating village - superb.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: We both had spa treatment. I had a Thai Massage which was fanatastic and my partner numerous things including a facial which she also enjoyed very much.
reviews.title: Amazing!

likes.liked: — Amazing setting. Phenomenal beach and restaurant

reviews.title: To rest your body and soul, go to Tubkaak!!
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful beach, amazing staff, food and rooms also great!
reviews.title: A place to indulge in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort was truly wonderful. The beach front room was beautifully decorated with a fine attention to detail. The restaurant was one of the best I have been to. We ate all our meals here and loved every one of them. I still dream of the lemon grass ice tea. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to please. If your after a place filled with action, entertainment and parties, this is not the place for you. Tubkaak is a place to wind down and loose yourself in it's luxury.
reviews.title: Service, Location, Maintenance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The majority of reviews here are exactly right. This is a great property. The service from the staff is outstanding - this is what makes a good resort into a great one. Also, the upkeep on the buildings and gardens is excellent. Normally, I try to avoid Thai resorts that are more then one or two years old because even the nice ones tend to fall into disrepair. The staff and management keep the Tubkaak very well maintained. The overall design of the resort is outstanding and as the buildings age, they actually attain more character.
reviews.title: Relax!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for 5 nights in a deluxe room, garden view. It was quiet, of good size (with high ceilings) and located on the second floor. The bathroom was beautiful.
reviews.title: For couples and honeymooners-a great boutique hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fabulous week in Tubkaak, outside Krabi, last December, having just spent three pampering nights in the legendary Oriental hotel in Bangkok. We chose the resort with the following purpose in mind: to do nothing, apart from sleep, read, catch some sun and enjoy good Thai food, all in a friendly, quiet and ecological environment. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a seaview villa. Seaview in Tubkaak is somewhat restricted, due to the eco-friendly policy of the resort, which minimises any visual impact (from the beach and the sea, you can hardly spot the bungalows, some 20-meters behind the trees). This contrasts with the two or three newly built neighbouring resorts, where all trees have been knocked down. Apart from preserving the environment, keeping the trees in the resort also means there is enough shade to protect from the intense heat of the sun.
reviews.title: Excellent and superb in every way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort only employs local staff, which is noteworthy. Staff, especially at the restaurant, were genuinely friendly and helpful. At times, their English was limited, but we were happy to encourage them to speak and improve their English. Tipping policy is very fair, as tipping is included in the prices of food and drinks and is distributed amongst whole staff.
reviews.title: amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in, we were given the nearest villa to the restaurant area, by one of the main walking paths. It was definitely the least private bungalow in the seaview range (villa 105). We changed to a suite in a much bigger and comfortable bungalow at the opposite end facing the sea (villa 101). Unlike the other villas (two in each bungalow), this one was totally isolated and private. When entering the bungalow, one passes the living area before reaching the large ensuite bedroom with a super king-size bed and flat screen TV. The ensuite bathroom is at the back of the bungalow and includes a large walk-in shower and outdoor bathtub, discretely tucked away from other guests' view. Through the big door-windows of the bedroom and living area, there is a private deck overlooking the sea and well kept gardens with its tropical trees in between.
reviews.title: Perfection

likes.liked: — The beach and the quality of service
likes.disliked: — If I had to be picky it would be the slow internet connection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a swimming pool a long way behind the seaview bungalows (where most guests seemed to spend their day), but we never used it. We enjoyed sitting on the beautiful Tubkaak beach, reading and looking at the sea, where we would refresh every now and then (very warm sea temperature, though). The beach was practically empty at all times while we were there, pure peace and quiet, only interrupted by the sight of the friendly waiters from the restaurant-bar popping down to check whether we would wish to order yet another refreshment.
reviews.title: Stylish, tranquil getaway boutique resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 5 nights to finish off honeymoon. Brilliant chillout
reviews.title: Favourite Hotel ever

likes.liked: — Design of the room is different to other hotels and everything feels special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was sunny + humid in the day and generally rainy at night.
reviews.title: Magical, simply magical

reviews.text: Highlights
reviews.title: Third time at the Tubkaak and we will be going back for more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic sunsets (even when it was rainy, lightning was cool to watch)
reviews.title: Honeymoon Hideaway

likes.liked: — Our room - the rain showers...the outdoor shower...the outdoor bathtub...
likes.disliked: — It seemed like a long trip from the airpiort, but it was also very late at night...I may have just been tired.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Design - It is different to other hotels "inspired" by design of local boats - Attention to detail eg rooms have wooden bars to lock the doors, outside showers and bath are great
reviews.title: Fantastic Staff

aka: The Tubkaak Krabi Boutique Hotel Nong Thale
description: A very chic boutique resort with just 42 stylistically finished rooms located at Krabi's most pristine Tubkaak Beach. Offering utmost privacy, spellbound tranquility with friendly service.
